column1: Jersey's coronavirus helpline has closed as the government continues to wind back pandemic measures.The service was set up in 2020 to provide advice and help islanders book PCR tests and vaccinations.Prof Peter Bradley
column3: said the helpline was a key part of the island's pandemic response."I'd like to thank everyone who has worked extremely hard since the helpline launched in 2020
column4: he said.They have been instrumental in ensuring islanders were supported through the pandemic."
